textElements.regularText:
During combat the Priest deepens his connection with the Aether and they use that connection to empower their spells or other magical abilities.
At the start of the fight the Priest rolls a number of d6 equal to half their [SPI] (rounded down). These dice represent the current Aether dice pool, the lower the value the more they represent good and the higher the values the more they represent Evil. During the battle these dice can change and additional dice are added.

bulletPoints: At the start of each of the Priest’s turn he receives one random Aether dice.
Falling Unconcious removes all current Aether Dice.

classPathDescription: The Priest is different form other classes in that their class Paths are tied to the characters alignment. This means that you are usually tied to 2 Class Paths unless you are True Neutral. These class Paths modify how you generate Aether Dice and what class Techniques you can access.

bulletPoints: You gain access to "Good" Class Techniques
The first time on your turn you heal an ally or grant a positive status effect,you gain one Aether Dice equal to d3.
You gain access to "Evil" Class Techniques
When you damage an enemy or inflict a negative status effect on them you gain one Aether Dice equal d3+3.
You gain access to "Order" Class Techniques
The first time on your turn you succeed a [SAVE] or remove a status effect from a creature you gain one Aether Dice you already have, if you have none none you can choose one.
You gain access to "Chaos" Class Techniques

At the start of your turn you can decide to reroll all of your TotA dice from your pool. Additionally the first time on each turn you modify a roll (bonus, penalty, reroll) you gain a random aether dice.

If you are good or evil you gain access to "Order" and "Chaos" Class Techniques. If you are chaotic or lawful you gain access to "Good" and "Evil" Class Techniques. If you are true neutral you gain access to all.
If you are partially neutral you can gain an aether dice twice per turn from your other alignment. If you are true neutral you now get an additional aether dice at the start of your turn.

textElements.regularText: You gain access the following ability:

ability.name: Divine Blessing
ability.description: A number of friendly creatures up to half your [CHA] (rounded down, minimum 1) recieve [THP] equal to your [SPI] and they recieve [BLESS 1]

textElements.regularText: You gain access the following ability:

ability.name: Unholy Curse
ability.description: You can target up to half your [CHA] , minimum 1 (rounded down) creatures. Make a [SPELLCASTING TEST] against their [WILLPOWER] on a success they recieve unholy damage equal to your [SPI] and the [BANE 1] status effect.

textElements.regularText: The Priest can use their [ARCANA] to fuel the Energies of the Aether. For 1 [AP] they can spend [ARCANA] and gain an equal amount of random Aether Dice equal to the [ARCANA] spent. If you spend more than 2 [ARCANA] and you roll the same dice twice you have to roll on the Cosmic Spellcasting Misshap Table

The Priest is able to perform minor miracles as long as they keep their faith. These miracles can’t generally be used in combat and take concentration and a clear mind to perform. Choose one of the following miracles below:

bulletPoints: Provide tasty food and drink for up to 20 people.
Heal a crature up to full [HP].
End all Tier 1 and 2 negative status effects affecting a Crature.
Restore 2 Stamina to all party members.

textElements.regularText: Alternatively they might also perform a different miracles if agreed by the GM. After they performed a minor miracle they can’t do it any more, once at the start of each day they make a prayer and make a DC 25 [SPI] [ATTRIBUTE TEST] which can’t be modified in any other way. They can repeat the Test each following day where they reduce the DC by 5 until they succeed. Alternatively if the Priest Character acts well within their believes or played well the GM may grant them the Miracle again without rolling.

For each Aether dice with a value of 1 you currently have in your Aether Dice Pool you positively affect the battlefield in a 9m aura around you. The more 1 dice you have currently in your pool, the stronger the effects are:

bulletPoints: 1. The area within your aura is brightly lit.
2. Each friendly creature that is within the aura gains resistance([SPI]) against unholy damage.
3. Each evil creature that starts their turn in your aura recieves holy damage equal to your [SPI].

textElements.regularText: For each Aether dice with a value of 6 you currently have in your Aether Dice Pool you positively affect the battlefield in a 9m aura around you. The more 6 dice you have currently in your pool, the stronger the effects are:

bulletPoints: 1. Every good creature within the area is now vulnurable to unholy damage.
2. Each creature that starts their turn in your aura recieves unholy damage equal to your [SPI].
3. The area within your aura is shrouded in darkness through which you and your alies can see through. Only magical effects of a spell power greater than [SPI]/3 can illuminate it.

textElements.regularText: The Priest has exceptional faith in his believes and fears no danger. The Priest can use a half of their [SPI] for calculating [HARDNESS], [DODGE] and [TOUGHNESS] instead of [STR] [AGI] and [CON].
The Priest is now able to perform greater miracles in addition to the ones he can already do:

bulletPoints: Provide tasty food and drink for for a village.
Heal your party to full [HP].
End all negative status effects affecting a Creature.
Restore 5 [STAMINA] to all party members.

textElements.regularText: When performing such a Miracle the DC for being able to use a Miracle again starts now at 50.
The Priest is now able to perform even greater miracles in addition to the ones he can already do:

bulletPoints: Provide tasty food and drink for a town.
Restore a creature to life which has died within the last hour.
Summon an angel to assist you

textElements.regularText: When performing such a Miracle the DC for being able to use a Miracle again starts now at 100.
The Priest is able to perform mighty acts that rival the power of a god-like being, these can be performed regardless if they are eligble to perform a miracle or not:

bulletPoints: If the cleric died or they soul became trapped or bound they can use this ability and come back alive with their soul being returned to them. Talk with the GM on how they came back.

They can sacrifice themselves and matyr for their allies or cause. When doing so they can’t be resurrected with their soul now being bound to the aether. For this sacriface they can alter reality in a major way they wish, examples: Forever bind an evli entity somewhere, reverse the destruction of a major city, ....

textElements.regularText: When performing such an act, they can’t do so again.
